title: Amish Friendship Bread Starter Recipe
description: This Amish friendship bread starter recipe combines yeast, sugar, milk, and flour to create a sweet fermented sourdough starter to share with friends.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Bread Yeast Bread Recipes Sourdough Bread Recipes Amish Friendship Bread Starter 4.9 (393) 296 Reviews 15 Photos This recipe for Amish friendship bread starter can make a variety of breads and is perfect for sharing with friends! Submitted by GINNY LEE Updated on February 27, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 15 15 15 15 Prep Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 10 days 10 mins Total Time: 10 days 40 mins Servings: 120 Yield: 4 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 120 servings 1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast ¼ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C) 3 cups all-purpose flour, divided 3 cups white sugar, divided 3 cups milk, divided Directions Gather all ingredients. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Dissolve yeast in warm water in a small bowl; let stand until foamy, about 10 minutes. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Combine 1 cup flour and 1 cup sugar in a 2-quart container (glass, plastic, or ceramic); mix thoroughly. Stir in 1 cup milk and yeast mixture. Cover the container loosely and leave at room temperature until bubbly. This is day 1 of the 10-day process. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Days 2 through 4: Stir starter with a spoon. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Day 5: Stir in 1 cup flour, 1 cup sugar, and 1 cup milk. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Days 6 through 9: Stir starter with a spoon. Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga Day 10: Stir in remaining 1 cup flour, 1 cup sugar, and 1 cup milk. Remove 1 cup starter to make your first bread. Give 2 cups starter to friends (1 cup each) along with this recipe and your favorite Amish bread recipe. Store remaining 1 cup starter in a container in the refrigerator or begin the 10-day process over again (beginning with step 2). Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga From the Editor Once you have made the starter, you will consider it day 1, so you can ignore step 1 in this recipe and proceed with step 2. You can also freeze the starter in 1 cup measures for later use. Frozen starter will take at least 3 hours at room temperature to thaw before using. Get the recipe for Amish Friendship Bread. I Made It Print 725 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Amish Friendship Bread Starter 01 of 15 Photo by  Allrecipes / Diana Chistruga 02 of 15 Photo by  TwistyFlan1574 02/26/2025 Easy to follow Worth the effort Great flavors It was worth the effort. This was my first time making a sweet starter, and I was surprised by how easy it was to keep going. It added a subtle tangy sweetness to the breads I made, making them extra soft and flavorful 03 of 15 Photo by  GreenSquid3120 01/21/2024 Made one loaf so far. Getting ready for my 2nd. I’d like to find more suggestions for variations. I’m not very creative. 04 of 15 Photo by  Michelle Koether 04/26/2020 05 of 15 Photo by  ape 06/05/2016 06 of 15 Photo by  Carolyn Orellana 10/21/2015 07 of 15 Photo by  Linda 07/26/2011 I love Amish Friendship Bread and was happy to have found this starter recipe. It works with excellant results and is just what I need to start a Friendship Bread circulating to be enjoyed. Follow the directions and you will not be disappointed. 08 of 15 Photo by  Linda 07/26/2011 I love Amish Friendship Bread and was happy to have found this starter recipe. It works with excellant results and is just what I need to start a Friendship Bread circulating to be enjoyed. Follow the directions and you will not be disappointed. 09 of 15 Photo by  Melissa Hodges 12/17/2010 10 of 15 Photo by  Ryan Tribbett 01/25/2010 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Sourdough Bread III 88 Ratings San Francisco Sourdough Bread 568 Ratings Amish Friendship Chocolate Bread 102 Ratings Lemon Poppy Seed Amish Friendship Bread 65 Ratings Grandma Skeet's Prune Kolaches 15 Ratings Amish Friendship Bread 159 Ratings French Quarter Beignets 3 Ratings Gooey Butter Cake I 140 Ratings Decadent Ozark Peach Turnovers 12 Ratings Herman Sourdough Starter 51 Ratings Apple Banana Cupcakes 444 Ratings Blackberry Dumplings 36 Ratings Ruth's Chocolate Pecan Pie 254 Ratings Malasadas 88 Ratings Malasadas Dois 21 Ratings Homestead Harvest Cookies Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
